full_summary:
================================
# Tender Title

## Project Management Services for Diving Equipment Recompression Chamber and Small Boats Sustainment Business Case Analysis

### Request for Proposal

The Department of National Defence (DND) invites qualified Supply Arrangement (SA) holders to submit a proposal for the provision of project management services in support of the Sustainment Business Case Analysis (SBCA) for the Diving Equipment Recompression Chamber In Service Sustainment (DRISS) and Small Boats procurements.

### Background

The DND has a requirement to procure project management services to support the development and progression of the SBCA. The services are expected to commence in September 2023 and will continue for a period of 390 days, with the option for two (2) one (1) year extensions.

### Scope of Work

The successful contractor will provide project management services to support the SBCA, including the development and implementation of project plans, management of project risks and issues, and coordination with stakeholders. The contractor will also be responsible for providing regular progress reports and ensuring that the project is delivered within scope, time, and budget.

### Tender Requirements

* The successful contractor must have a proven track record of delivering project management services in a similar context.
* The contractor must have the required security clearance to access classified information.
* The contractor must have a team with the necessary skills and expertise to deliver the project.
* The contractor must provide a comprehensive project plan, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation.

### Evaluation Criteria

The tender will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical Merit (50%): The contractor's ability to deliver the project management services in accordance with the requirements specified.
* Price (30%): The contractor's proposed price for the services.
* Past Performance (20%): The contractor's past performance on similar projects.

### Tender Process

The tender process will be conducted electronically through the Government Electronic Tendering System. The Request for Proposal (RFP) documents will be e-mailed directly to the qualified SA holders who are being invited to submit a proposal.

### Contact Information

For any inquiries or questions regarding the tender, please contact:

Amy Fisher
DMarP3BidSubmission-DOMar3Soumissiondesoffres@forces.gc.ca
(343) 576-7391

### Deadline

The closing date for the tender is 10:00 a.m. on 2023-09-08. Any proposals received after this date and time will not
